parameters.description:
Evals can be ordered by creation time or last updated time. Use
`created_at` for creation time or `updated_at` for last updated time.

post.description:
Create the structure of an evaluation that can be used to test a model's performance.
An evaluation is a set of testing criteria and the config for a data source, which dictates the schema of the data used in the evaluation. After creating an evaluation, you can run it on different models and model parameters. We support several types of graders and datasources.
For more information, see the [Evals guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/evals).

Eval.description:
An Eval object with a data source config and testing criteria.
An Eval represents a task to be done for your LLM integration.
Like:
- Improve the quality of my chatbot
- See how well my chatbot handles customer support
- Check if o4-mini is better at my usecase than gpt-4o
Eval.title: Eval

The code interpreter container. Can be a container ID or an object that

type.description: Always `auto`.

file_ids.description: An optional list of uploaded files to make available to your code.

Configuration for a code interpreter container. Optionally specify the IDs
of the files to run the code on.

type.description:
Specifies the comparison operator:
`eq` (equal), `ne` (not equal), `gt` (greater than), `gte` (greater than or equal), `lt` (less than), `lte` (less than or equal).

key.description: The key to compare against the value.

value.description: The value to compare against the attribute key; supports string, number, or boolean types.

OpenAI.ComparisonFilter.description: A filter used to compare a specified attribute key to a given value using a defined comparison operation.

type.description: Type of operation: `and` or `or`.

filters.description: Array of filters to combine. Items can be `ComparisonFilter` or `CompoundFilter`.

type.description: The type of the computer use tool. Always `computer_use_preview`.

environment.description: The type of computer environment to control.

display_width.description: The width of the computer display.

display_height.description: The height of the computer display.

OpenAI.ComputerUsePreviewTool.description: A tool that controls a virtual computer. Learn more about the [computer tool](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-computer-use).

type.description: The type of run data source. Always `completions`.

input_messages.description: Used when sampling from a model. Dictates the structure of the messages passed into the model. Can either be a reference to a prebuilt trajectory (ie, `item.input_trajectory`), or a template with variable references to the `item` namespace.

model.description: The name of the model to use for generating completions (e.g. "o3-mini").

source.description: Determines what populates the `item` namespace in this run's data source.

OpenAI.CreateEvalCompletionsRunDataSourc.description: A CompletionsRunDataSource object describing a model sampling configuration.

item_schema.description: The json schema for each row in the data source.

include_sample_schema.description: Whether the eval should expect you to populate the sample namespace (ie, by generating responses off of your data source)

OpenAI.CreateEvalCustomDataSourceConfig.description:
A CustomDataSourceConfig object that defines the schema for the data source used for the evaluation runs.
This schema is used to define the shape of the data that will be:
- Used to define your testing criteria and
- What data is required when creating a run

A data source config which specifies the metadata property of your logs query.
This is usually metadata like `usecase=chatbot` or `prompt-version=v2`, etc.
OpenAI.CreateEvalLogsDataSourceConfig.title: LogsDataSourceConfig

x-oaiMeta.name: The logs data source object for evals

type.description: The type of run data source. Always `responses`.

input_messages.description: Used when sampling from a model. Dictates the structure of the messages passed into the model. Can either be a reference to a prebuilt trajectory (ie, `item.input_trajectory`), or a template with variable references to the `item` namespace.

model.description: The name of the model to use for generating completions (e.g. "o3-mini").

source.description: Determines what populates the `item` namespace in this run's data source.

OpenAI.CreateEvalResponsesRunDataSource.description: A ResponsesRunDataSource object describing a model sampling configuration.
OpenAI.CreateEvalResponsesRunDataSource.title: ResponsesRunDataSource

x-oaiMeta.name: The completions data source object used to configure an individual run

type.description: The type of data source. Always `stored_completions`.

metadata.description: Metadata filters for the stored completions data source.

x-oaiMeta.name: The stored completions data source object for evals

OpenAI.EvalApiError.description: An object representing an error response from the Eval API.
OpenAI.EvalApiError.title: EvalApiError

x-oaiMeta.name: The API error object

type.description: The object type, which is always `label_model`.

model.description: The model to use for the evaluation. Must support structured outputs.

labels.description: The labels to assign to each item in the evaluation.

passing_labels.description: The labels that indicate a passing result. Must be a subset of labels.

type.description: The object type, which is always `python`.

source.description: The source code of the python script.

image_tag.description: The image tag to use for the python script.

type.description: The object type, which is always `score_model`.

model.description: The model to use for the evaluation.

sampling_params.description: The sampling parameters for the model.

input.description: The input text. This may include template strings.

range.description: The range of the score. Defaults to `[0, 1]`.

type.description: The object type, which is always `string_check`.

input.description: The input text. This may include template strings.

reference.description: The reference text. This may include template strings.

operation.description: The string check operation to perform. One of `eq`, `ne`, `like`, or `ilike`.

type.description: The type of grader.

evaluation_metric.description:
The evaluation metric to use. One of `cosine`, `fuzzy_match`, `bleu`,
  `gleu`, `meteor`, `rouge_1`, `rouge_2`, `rouge_3`, `rouge_4`, `rouge_5`,
  or `rouge_l`.

role.description:
The role of the message input. One of `user`, `assistant`, `system`, or
  `developer`.

content.description: Inputs to the model - can contain template strings.

type.description: The type of the message input. Always `message`.

OpenAI.EvalItem.description:
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role. Messages with the
`assistant` role are presumed to have been generated by the model in previous
interactions.
OpenAI.EvalItem.title: Eval message object

type.description: The type of jsonl source. Always `file_content`.

content.description: The content of the jsonl file.

type.description: The type of jsonl source. Always `file_id`.
The type of run data source. Always `responses`.

OpenAI.EvalResponsesSource.description: A EvalResponsesSource object describing a run data source configuration.
OpenAI.EvalResponsesSource.title: EvalResponsesSource

x-oaiMeta.name: The run data source object used to configure an individual run

type.description: The type of source. Always `stored_completions`.

OpenAI.EvalStoredCompletionsSource.description: A StoredCompletionsRunDataSource configuration describing a set of filters
OpenAI.EvalStoredCompletionsSource.title: StoredCompletionsRunDataSource

x-oaiMeta.name: The stored completions data source object used to configure an individual run

type.description: The type of the file search tool. Always `file_search`.

vector_store_ids.description: The IDs of the vector stores to search.

max_num_results.description: The maximum number of results to return. This number should be between 1 and 50 inclusive.

OpenAI.FileSearchTool.description: A tool that searches for relevant content from uploaded files. Learn more about the [file search tool](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-file-search).

description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

parameters.description:
The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object. See the [guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling) for examples, and the [JSON Schema reference](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/) for documentation about the format.

Omitting `parameters` defines a function with an empty parameter list.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the function call. If set to true, the model will follow the exact schema defined in the `parameters` field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when `strict` is `true`. Learn more about Structured Outputs in the [function calling guide](docs/guides/function-calling).

type.description: The type of the function tool. Always `function`.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

description.description: A description of the function. Used by the model to determine whether or not to call the function.

parameters.description: A JSON schema object describing the parameters of the function.

strict.description: Whether to enforce strict parameter validation. Default `true`.

OpenAI.FunctionTool.description: Defines a function in your own code the model can choose to call. Learn more about [function calling](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling).

type.description: The type of the image generation tool. Always `image_generation`.

model.description: The image generation model to use. Default: `gpt-image-1`.

quality.description:
The quality of the generated image. One of `low`, `medium`, `high`,
or `auto`. Default: `auto`.

size.description:
The size of the generated image. One of `1024x1024`, `1024x1536`,
`1536x1024`, or `auto`. Default: `auto`.

output_format.description:
The output format of the generated image. One of `png`, `webp`, or
`jpeg`. Default: `png`.

output_compression.description: Compression level for the output image. Default: 100.

moderation.description: Moderation level for the generated image. Default: `auto`.

background.description:
Background type for the generated image. One of `transparent`,
`opaque`, or `auto`. Default: `auto`.

file_id.description: File ID for the mask image.

input_image_mask.description:
Optional mask for inpainting. Contains `image_url`
(string, optional) and `file_id` (string, optional).

partial_images.description: Number of partial images to generate in streaming mode, from 0 (default value) to 3.

OpenAI.ImageGenTool.description: A tool that generates images using a model like `gpt-image-1`.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_audio`.

format.description:
The format of the audio data. Currently supported formats are `mp3` and
`wav`.

OpenAI.ItemContentInputAudio.description: An audio input to the model.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_file`.

file_id.description: The ID of the file to be sent to the model.

filename.description: The name of the file to be sent to the model.

file_data.description: The content of the file to be sent to the model.

OpenAI.ItemContentInputFile.description: A file input to the model.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_image`.

image_url.description: The URL of the image to be sent to the model. A fully qualified URL or base64 encoded image in a data URL.

file_id.description: The ID of the file to be sent to the model.

detail.description: The detail level of the image to be sent to the model. One of `high`, `low`, or `auto`. Defaults to `auto`.

OpenAI.ItemContentInputImage.description: An image input to the model. Learn about [image inputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/vision).

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_text`.

text.description: The text input to the model.

OpenAI.ItemContentInputText.description: A text input to the model.

type.description: The type of the output audio. Always `output_audio`.

data.description: Base64-encoded audio data from the model.

transcript.description: The transcript of the audio data from the model.

OpenAI.ItemContentOutputAudio.description: An audio output from the model.

type.description: The type of the output text. Always `output_text`.

text.description: The text output from the model.

annotations.description: The annotations of the text output.

OpenAI.ItemContentOutputText.description: A text output from the model.

type.description: The type of the refusal. Always `refusal`.
The type of the local shell tool. Always `local_shell`.

OpenAI.LocalShellTool.description: A tool that allows the model to execute shell commands in a local environment.

OpenAI.LogProb.description: The log probability of a token.

type.description: The type of the MCP tool. Always `mcp`.

server_label.description: A label for this MCP server, used to identify it in tool calls.

server_url.description: The URL for the MCP server.

headers.description:
Optional HTTP headers to send to the MCP server. Use for authentication
or other purposes.

allowed_tools.description: List of allowed tool names or a filter object.

tool_names.description: List of tools that require approval.

always.description: A list of tools that always require approval.

tool_names.description: List of tools that do not require approval.

never.description: A list of tools that never require approval.

require_approval.description: Specify which of the MCP server's tools require approval.

OpenAI.MCPTool.description:
Give the model access to additional tools via remote Model Context Protocol
(MCP) servers. [Learn more about MCP](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-remote-mcp).

OpenAI.Metadata.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard.

Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings
with a maximum length of 512 characters.

ranker.description: The ranker to use for the file search.

score_threshold.description: The score threshold for the file search, a number between 0 and 1. Numbers closer to 1 will attempt to return only the most relevant results, but may return fewer results.

OpenAI.ReasoningEffort.description:
Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models.

Currently supported values are none, minimal, low, medium, and high.

Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

gpt-5.1 defaults to none, which does not perform reasoning. The supported reasoning values for gpt-5.1 are none, low, medium, and high. Tool calls are supported for all reasoning values in gpt-5.1.

All models before gpt-5.1 default to medium reasoning effort, and do not support none.

The gpt-5-pro model defaults to (and only supports) high reasoning effort.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `json_object`.

OpenAI.ResponseFormatJsonObject.description:
JSON object response format. An older method of generating JSON responses.
Using `json_schema` is recommended for models that support it. Note that the
model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it
to do so.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `json_schema`.

description.description:
A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to
determine how to respond in the format.

name.description:
The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain
underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

strict.description:
Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output.
If set to true, the model will always follow the exact schema defined
in the `schema` field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when
`strict` is `true`. To learn more, read the [Structured Outputs
guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/structured-outputs).

json_schema.description: Structured Outputs configuration options, including a JSON Schema.

OpenAI.ResponseFormatJsonSchema.description:
The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.
Learn how to build JSON schemas [here](https://json-schema.org/).JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.
Learn more about [Structured Outputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/structured-outputs).

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `text`.

OpenAI.ResponseFormatText.description: Default response format. Used to generate text responses.

OpenAI.TextResponseFormatConfiguration.description:
An object specifying the format that the model must output.

Configuring `{ "type": "json_schema" }` enables Structured Outputs,
which ensures the model will match your supplied JSON schema. Learn more in the
[Structured Outputs guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/structured-outputs).

The default format is `{ "type": "text" }` with no additional options.

*Not recommended for gpt-4o and newer models:**

Setting to `{ "type": "json_object" }` enables the older JSON mode, which
ensures the message the model generates is valid JSON. Using `json_schema`
is preferred for models that support it.

OpenAI.ToolType.description: A tool that can be used to generate a response.

OpenAI.TopLogProb.description: The top log probability of a token.

type.description: The type of the web search tool. One of `web_search_preview` or `web_search_preview_2025_03_11`.

search_context_size.description: High level guidance for the amount of context window space to use for the search. One of `low`, `medium`, or `high`. `medium` is the default.

OpenAI.WebSearchPreviewTool.description: Note: web_search is not yet available via Azure OpenAI.

type.description: The object type, which is always 'openapi'.

OpenApiAgentTool.description: The input definition information for an OpenAPI tool as used to configure an agent.

type.description: The object type, which is always 'anonymous'.

OpenApiAnonymousAuthDetails.description: Security details for OpenApi anonymous authentication

type.description: The type of authentication, must be anonymous/project_connection/managed_identity

OpenApiAuthType.description:
Authentication type for OpenApi endpoint. Allowed types are:
- Anonymous (no authentication required)
- Project Connection (requires project_connection_id to endpoint, as setup in AI Foundry)
- Managed_Identity (requires audience for identity based auth)

name.description: The name of the function to be called.

description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

spec.description: The openapi function shape, described as a JSON Schema object.

default_params.description: List of OpenAPI spec parameters that will use user-provided defaults

name.description: The name of the function to be called.

description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

parameters.description: The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object.

functions.description: List of function definitions used by OpenApi tool

OpenApiFunctionDefinition.description: The input definition information for an openapi function.

type.description: The object type, which is always 'managed_identity'.

OpenApiManagedAuthDetails.description: Security details for OpenApi managed_identity authentication

audience.description: Authentication scope for managed_identity auth type

OpenApiManagedSecurityScheme.description: Security scheme for OpenApi managed_identity authentication

type.description: The object type, which is always 'project_connection'.

OpenApiProjectConnectionAuthDetails.description: Security details for OpenApi project connection authentication

project_connection_id.description: Project connection id for Project Connection auth type

OpenApiProjectConnectionSecurityScheme.description: Security scheme for OpenApi managed_identity authentication

value.description: The Connection items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

value.description: The DatasetVersion items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

value.description: The Deployment items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

pendingUploadId.description: If PendingUploadId is not provided, a random GUID will be used.

connectionName.description: Azure Storage Account connection name to use for generating temporary SAS token

pendingUploadType.description: BlobReference is the only supported type.

PendingUploadRequest.description: Represents a request for a pending upload.

version.description: Version of asset to be created if user did not specify version when initially creating upload

pendingUploadType.description: BlobReference is the only supported type

PendingUploadResponse.description: Represents the response for a pending upload request

type.description: The credential type
Type of credential
The object type, which is always 'sharepoint_grounding'.

SharepointAgentTool.description: The input definition information for a sharepoint tool as used to configure an agent.

project_connections.description:
The project connections attached to this tool. There can be a maximum of 1 connection
resource attached to the tool.

name.description: The name of the structured output.

description.description: A description of the output to emit. Used by the model to determine when to emit the output.

schema.description: The JSON schema for the structured output.

strict.description: Whether to enforce strict validation. Default `true`.

StructuredOutputDefinition.description: A structured output that can be produced by the agent.

project_connection_id.description: A project connection in a ToolProjectConnectionList attached to this tool.

properties.description:
Set of immutable 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object for storing additional information.
    Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum length of 512 characters.

endpoint.description:
Foundry Project endpoint in the form
"https://{ai-services-account-name}.services.ai.azure.com/api/projects/{project-name}".
If you only have one Project in your Foundry Hub, or to target the default Project
in your Hub, use the form
"https://{ai-services-account-name}.services.ai.azure.com/api/projects/_project"
